text: Missouri's second congressional district is in the eastern portion of the state, primarily consisting of the suburbs south and west of St. Louis, including Arnold, Town and Country, Wildwood, Chesterfield, and Oakville.McDermott, Kevin. "Missouri state Rep. Otto to seek 2nd Congressional District seat". St. Louis Post-Dispatch. May 26, 2015. The district includes portions of St. Louis, Jefferson and St. Charles counties."Missouri's 2nd Congressional District" https://ballotpedia.org/Missouri%27s_2nd_Congressional_District#cite_note-2 Following redistricting in 2010, the St. Louis Post-Dispatch reported that the district now included more Democratic-leaning voters than it had its 2001–2010 boundaries, but still leaned Republican as a whole.Wagman, Jake. "Missouri's 2nd District will see classic battle." St. Louis Post-Dispatch. July 7, 2011. The latest U.S. Census Electorate Profile for the 2nd congressional district estimates there are 581,131 citizens of voting age living in 293,984 households. Its current representative is Republican Ann Wagner. Wagner faced Democrat Cort VanOstran, Libertarian Larry A. Kirk and the Green Party's David Justus Arnold in the 2018 general election.https://www.nytimes.com/elections/results/missouri-house- district-2-primary-election "Missouri Primary Election Results: Second House District." == List of members representing the district == {| class=wikitable style="text-align:center" |- valign=bottom !
